did.abstract: The Gregory Maguire Papers are a collection of materials from the American novelist. He is the author of Wicked: The Life and Times of the Wicked Witch of the West, Out of Oz, and several dozen other novels for adults and children.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by Gregory Maguire in 2012, 2014, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2020 and 2022.

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Gregory Maguire was born June 9, 1954 in Albany, NY. He received his PhD in English and American Literature from Tufts University, his M.A. in Children's Literature from Simmons College, and his BA from the State University of New York at Albany (now the University at Albany). He is The New York Times bestselling author of Wicked: The Life and Times of the Wicked Witch of the West, Confessions of an Ugly Stepsister, and several dozen other novels for adults and children. Many of Maguire's novels are based on classic children's stories.
Gregory Maguire also co-founded a nonprofit educational charity, Children's Literature New England, Inc. (CLNE).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence, artwork, and drafts of works by Gregory Maguire. The collection also holds clippings from Maguire's father from his time as a reporter in Albany, NY, writings from other family members, family correspondence, genealogical materials, and souvenir booklets from Wicked, the musicial, from performances around the world.
